alert.note: Alert for Grant; Morton; Seward; Stanton; Stevens (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 03 at 10:59AM CDT until April 04 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...Critical Wildfire Danger Far Southwest Kansas Monday Afternoon... ...Widespread Dangerous Wildfire Conditions Tuesday... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 074, 075, 084, 085, AND 086... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 11 PM CDT TUESDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 074, 075, 084, 085, AND 086... The National Weather Service in Dodge City has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 9 AM to 11 PM CDT Tuesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...In Kansas, Fire Weather Zone 074 Stanton, Fire Weather Zone 075 Grant, Fire Weather Zone 084 Morton, Fire Weather Zone 085 Stevens and Fire Weather Zone 086 Seward. * WINDS...Monday: Southwest 20 to 30 mph, gusts to 45 mph. Tuesday: Southwest 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 mph. An abrupt shift to northwest wind is expected Tuesday evening. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 6 percent. * IMPACTS...Any ignition will have the potential to exhibit extreme fire behavior, and burn out of control. High end dangerous wildfire potential exists Tuesday.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
